# Including Plots

You can also embed plots. See Figure \@ref(fig:pie) for example:

```{r}

library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
fig <- plot_ly(
   type = 'scatterpolar',
 r = c(0,1,2,3),
theta = c(0,45,90,135),
   mode = 'markers' 
)

fig 

```


# Including Plots

You can also embed plots. See Figure \@ref(fig:pie) for example:

```{r}
 
library(plotly)
fig <- plot_ly(
   type = 'scatterpolar',
   r = c(0,1,2,2),
   theta = c(0,45,90,0),
   mode ='lines'
)

fig
 

```


# Including Plots

You can also embed plots. See Figure \@ref(fig:pie) for example:

```{r}
 library(plotly)

fig <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
  mode = 'lines+markers'
)

fig


```


# Including Plots

You can also embed plots. See Figure \@ref(fig:pie) for example:

```{r}
 library(plotly)
fig <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
  mode = 'lines+markers',
  fill = 'toself'
)
fig

```


# Including Plots

You can also embed plots. See Figure \@ref(fig:pie) for example:

```{r}
library(plotly)
fig <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
  mode = 'lines+markers', marker = list(size = 10),
  fill = 'toself'
  )
fig 

```
